reviews.review_msg: Dorothy is the best!!! I would take any course she teaches!

It was a privilege to have Dorothy as a professor. She does speak fast; it's not an issue unless you're trying to take notes word-for-word, but do expect to take 4-5 pages of notes per class. Passionate, approachable, and gives the most stimulating and engaging lectures. Fantastic class.

Dorothy is amazing. Best lecturer I have ever experienced. You can't find a higher level of clarity and interest anywhere. I took this class on a last-minute whim and it has been my favourite class so far.
Such a fantastic class. So great I'm now double majoring in it. Dorothy is very passionate and thought me a lot.

FPA 111 sure is an interesting course to take. Dorothy's lecture is clear and understandable. Sometimes I think she speaks a little bit too fast though. Also, it is kind of scary for her to mention about the academic dishonesty thing all the time...
AWESOME. SHE TRANSPORTS YOU TO THE MOST INTERESTING MOMENTS IN ART'S WORLD.

The first time I took Dorothy's class I only took it to fulfill my requirement. I hardly had any interest in the subject....But now, after taking her class I'm so glad that I did! She is incredibly sincere and extremely passionate about art and it really shows in her lecture. I'm thinking about minoring in Art and Culture because I loved it so much

Really good lecturer, really concise and interesting. Definitely take youre into the arts. Covers everything from conceptual art to punk rock.Assignments consisted of reporting/reviewing on local art/music/dance/film/theatre events. Exams involve a lot of writing.  Make sure to take detailed notes in lecture and definitely participate in tutorial!
Definately recommend taking this course! Dorothy was engaging and i found the class to be extremely interesting!

Dorothy is an excellent prof! She's passionate about what she teaches and really knows her stuff. Her lectures are very interesting and a great eye opener. The exams were fair and very easy if you attended lectures and took notes. The course requires a lot of essay writing. Overall, one of the best profs I've had, take her if you get the chance!
I am in a sciences program, but i took her class and i found it very interesting. As long as you know how to write an essay and take notes during her lectures the class is not that hard.
I've already talked to Dorothy about changing my major after taking this class. Opened my eyes to a whole new subject area I would not have normally found as potentially interesting.
WHAT EVER YOU, PLEASE PLEASE DONT TAKE THIS COURSE JUST FOR THE SAKE OF B-HUM CREDIT!!! A DISASTER FOR ALL NON-ARTS STUDENT!
Dr. Barenscott is passionate, witty, and crazy smart. She actually likes contemporary art, which is more than many art historians!

She speeks really fast, I can't catch up with her on my notes. The exam questions are actually short essays! You'll have about 4 essays total in the whole term. One thing I can't agree is that, why you arrange another "final" essay before the final exam after the real final essay had been hand in?? It'll occupy our study time on the final exam! But

i want to be the first to say that she sucks at teaching. she doesnt adjust to the class despite their opinions and recommendations to improve the learning environment in this course. the format of her exams were ridiculous: they are TOO TIME PACED! my goodness, just let us work at OUR speed, NOT YOURS! despise her. SFU, DONT HIRE HER AGAIN!
